alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Woodruff (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 6:55PM CST until further notice by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following river in Arkansas... Cache River Near Patterson affecting Woodruff and Jackson Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cache River Near Patterson. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Low swampy timberland along the river begins to flood. At 9.0 feet, Low swampy timberland along the river begins to flood. Flood gates should be closed and equipment moved out of the low grounds along the river and tributaries. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 PM CST Sunday the stage was 8.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage by early Tuesday afternoon and continue rising to 9.5 feet by early Wednesday afternoon. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.9 feet on 04/01/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecast 6 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Crest Time Date Cache River Patterson 9.0 8.2 Sun 6 PM 8.7 9.2 9.5 **RISING** &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
